citations.narrative:
The facility did not have a written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) for dogs available for review at the time of inspection.
Additionally, regularly scheduled visits, not less than once every 12 months, by the attending veterinarian have not been
conducted. A written program of veterinary care for dogs and regularly scheduled visits to the premises are crucial to
ensure dogs are receiving proper medical and preventive care, and that the facility is following the attending veterinarian’s
guidance. The facility must keep and maintain a written program of veterinary care for dogs that is signed by the attending
veterinarian and must ensure that site visits to the facility are conducted no less than once every 12 months. The written
program must also address all the requirements laid out in 3.13. Correct by March 31, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility did not have a written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) for dogs available for review at the time of inspection. 
Additionally, regularly scheduled visits, not less than once every 12 months, by the attending veterinarian have not been 
conducted. A written program of veterinary care for dogs and regularly scheduled visits to the premises are crucial to 
ensure dogs are receiving proper medical and preventive care, and that the facility is following the attending veterinarian’s 
guidance. The facility must keep and maintain a written program of veterinary care for dogs that is signed by the attending 
veterinarian and must ensure that site visits to the facility are conducted no less than once every 12 months. The written 
program must also address all the requirements laid out in 3.13. Correct by March 31, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
